Vanilla

Welcome to ye-old super vanilla webpage. Because nothing is precompiled by webpack's loaders, we can test the this's behavior on the frontend without any obfuscation

First things first: adding style

This page looks horrible. Let's jump into the editor, and hook up a style sheet the old fashioned way

  1. Open intro-to-frontend in your text editor of choice
  2. Navigate to /vanilla/dist/classic/index.html
  3. add a style link to the header <link href="./index.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

Not perfect, but better

Adding a script

Add <script type="text/javascript" src="./index.js"></script> above the </body> tag

Checking Console

To open the chrome developer console go the the top menu View > Developer > Developer Tools

You can also use the shortcut ⌥⌘i or alt⌘i

Strict Mode and this

Strict mode restricts javascript uses, and encourages good coding practices. More importantly, ES6, the new version of javascript, always enforces strict mode. For a full list of the differences read the mdn article

For now, we are going to look at how it affects the scope of this within a function. Comment out the "use strict"; line from /vanilla/dist/classic/index.js and see how the console output differs
